page.title: 08The Quarry
page.content:
Most of the area covered by the Quarry comes into another block, but a small part comes into our area. The work there started in l945 and now 112,000 tons of stone are quarried every year.
The rock face is blasted every 10 days and ll men are employed to crush, load and transport the stone away. About half of the men live locally. The machinery used is a crusher, tractors, dumper trucks and cranes.
The limestone quarried, which is full of fossils, is used for stone walls and buildings in its natural state, or ground up and mixed with cement to make Bradstone blocks for building. The remaining dust is sold to farmers for use as a fertiliser.
